evals.name: generate-organization-schema
evals.prompt: Generate an Organization schema for my company. The company is called 'TechFlow Solutions', website is techflow.io, and we're a cloud consulting firm founded in 2019.
evals.expected_output: Complete Organization JSON-LD with name, url, description, foundingDate, and proper @context.

evals.name: generate-article-schema
evals.prompt: Create an Article schema for our blog post. The title is 'Getting Started with Kubernetes', published on 2024-02-10, written by Sarah Chen.
evals.expected_output: Complete Article or BlogPosting schema with headline, author (Person), datePublished, publisher, and all required fields.

evals.name: generate-faq-schema
evals.prompt: Build an FAQPage schema with these Q&A pairs: Q1: What payment methods do you accept? A1: We accept all major credit cards, PayPal, and bank transfers. Q2: How do I reset my password? A2: Click 'Forgot Password' on the login page.
evals.expected_output: FAQPage schema with mainEntity array containing Question objects with name and acceptedAnswer fields.

evals.name: validate-schema
evals.prompt: Validate this schema for me: [user provides JSON-LD schema content]
evals.expected_output: Validation report indicating whether the schema is valid, listing any errors or warnings, and confirming required fields are present.

evals.name: product-schema-with-offers
evals.prompt: Generate a Product schema for our SaaS product. Product name is 'DataSync Pro', price is $99/month, brand is CloudBase.
evals.expected_output: Product schema with name, brand, offers object containing price, priceCurrency, and availability.

evals.name: batch-generate-from-sitemap
evals.prompt: Generate schemas for all pages in our sitemap at https://example.com/sitemap.xml
evals.expected_output: Multiple schema files generated based on detected page types (Article, Product, Organization, etc.) with proper content extraction.
